Canadian governor-general refers to exchange and cooperation with DPRK 
    Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Canadian governor-general Adrienne Clarkson laid stress on developing exchange and cooperation between Canada and the DPRK.
 The governor-general, when receiving credentials from the new DPRK ambassador on June 24, said that the establishment of diplomatic relations between the two countries opened a broad avenue to further promote the friendly relations.    
 Noting that she was well aware that the ongoing mass gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang" is attracting great popularity in the DPRK. She put emphasis on developing exchange and cooperation between the two countries in different fields including culture and art.
